description:
Renovation of a municipal facility in West Palm Beach, Florida. Completed plans call for the renovation of a municipal facility. You must attend this meeting if you intend to bid this work. Qualification of Contractors. Qualification is required in order to bid for projects under this Annual Contract. A contractor may obtain a Qualification Application for this Annual Contract by sending an email with the Project # in the subject line to: FDO-CID-Bids@pbc.gov or call (561) 233-0261. Qualification applications may also be downloaded from the Countys on-line Vendor Self-Service (VSS) system at Online, The contractor must submit the Qualification Application at least 10 days before the Quote/Bid Due Date in order for its quote/bid to be considered. Palm Beach County reserves the right to waive any bid irregularities, informalities, or technical deficiencies and to reject any and all quotes/bids.

description: Demolition, site work, paving and addition to a mixed-use development in Lighthouse Point, Florida. Completed plans call for the addition of a 1,800-square-foot, one-story above grade library; for the demolition of a library; for site work for a library; sidewalk / parking lot; water / sewer project; and for paving for a sidewalk / parking lot. The City of Lighthouse Point is seeking bids for the construction of a new City Library Addition. The new facility consists of a one-story approximately 1,800 square foot addition with a two-hour connection to the existing Library as part of the existing City Hall Complex. The building will be constructed of masonry block and painted stucco finish, wood trusses, and a new standing seam metal roof. All exterior windows and doors will be impact rated. project_name: FMB WRF Restoration and Capacity Enhancement
description:
Site work and renovation of a water / sewer project in Fort Myers Beach, Florida. Completed plans call for site work for a water / sewer project; and for the renovation of a water / sewer project. The Lee County Board of County Commissioners seeks to contract with a qualified CONTRACTOR to provide construction demolition, reconstruction, and upgrades to improve capacity, efficiency, and resiliency of the Fort Myers Beach Water Reclamation Facility. The project includes phased construction of new structures, advanced treatment systems, and significant subsurface and site improvements. The completed facility will achieve a permitted capacity of 6 MGD while incorporating modern technologies, enhanced infrastructure, and flood-resilient design features. Question Deadline 09/07/2025 at 12:00 PM ET Questions regarding this solicitation are to be submitted electronically

project_name: DeSoto County Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant Expansion - Phase 1
description: Demolition, site work and addition to a water / sewer project in Arcadia, Florida. Completed plans call for the addition of a water / sewer project; for the demolition of a water / sewer project; and for site work for a water / sewer project. GENERAL DeSoto County is seeking qualified Contractors to perform an expansion of treatment capacity and other auxiliary improvements to the existing DeSoto County Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant (DCR WWTP). The DCR WWTP is an extended aeration facility, located on a 160-acre County owned parcel on SE Highway 31, with a current permitted capacity of 0.950 million gallons per day (MGD) average daily flow. DeSoto County is proceeding with the first phase of the expansion to increase the DCR WWTP treatment and disposal capacity to 1.4 MGD. The adjacent 600-acre sprayfield site used for effluent disposal is presently leased by the County from a private landowner. project_name: Florida Sun Trail - Highwaymen Trail Gap(Indian Hills Dr to Georgia)
description:
Site work and paving for a road / highway in Fort Pierce, Florida. Completed plans call for site work for a road / highway; and for paving for a road / highway. The City of Fort Pierce is requesting bids from FDOT pre-qualified contractors for Florida SUN Trail - Highwayman Trail Gap from Indian Hills Drive to Georgia Avenue, Fort Pierce, Florida. The work associated with this project consists of construction of a 1.4 mile, 12' wide concrete multi-use path, three pedestrian boardwalk bridges, and harmonization of existing features. All inquiries will be in a written format and addressed to the Project Engineer with a copy to the Purchasing Manager: Selena Griffett, P.E. City of Fort Pierce 100 North U.S. #1 Fort Pierce, FL 34950 Phone: (772) 460-6847 Email: sgriffett@cityoffortpierce.com and Latonya Hubbard Purchasing Agent City of Fort Pierce 100 North U.S. #1 Fort Pierce, FL 34950 Fax: (772) 467-3848 Email: purchasing@cityoffortpierce.com
